The TzHaar-Ket are inhabitants of Mor Ul Rek. Some of them can be found wielding a Tzhaar-ket-om. Some will have no weapon wielded, while some wield up to three Tzhaar-ket-em to accompany, or a Toktz-ket-xil.

While fighting TzHaar-Ket, players can go into the Fight Caves and die to fully heal themselves and recharge Prayer. All TzHaar have an uncommon chance to drop uncut sapphires, uncut emeralds, and uncut rubies as well as a rare chance to drop uncut diamonds.

You can safespot the TzHaar-Ket by standing behind a sulphur vent south-west of the entrance of Mor Ul Rek using range or magic.

There are stronger TzHaar-Ket located in the inner area of the city which drop pieces of the obsidian armour set. In order to fight these, a fire cape must be shown to any TzHaar-Ket guard near the barrier (these guards are unattackable).

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
17 March 2021
(update)

TzHaar-Kets model has been shrunk a little, and they have returned to being one tile NPCs

3 March 2021
(update)

TzHaar-Kets were made into a two by two tile NPCs in an unlisted change

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • According to RuneScape - The First 20 Years, the TzHaar-Ket's appearance were visually inspired by crustaceans.
